org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.main

Class JsonSchemaFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eel.kitchen.jsonschema.main.JsonSchemaFactory

  • public final class JsonSchemaFactory
extends Object
    Factory to build JSON Schema validating instances

    You can create a factory with all default settings using defaultFactory(). This is what you will do in the vast majority of cases.

    If you want to customize it, you need to go through JsonSchemaFactory.Builder.

    This class is thread safe and immutable.

    See Also:
    JsonSchema

      Builder class for a JsonSchemaFactory

    • Method Detail

      • defaultFactory

        public static JsonSchemaFactory defaultFactory()
        Build a factory with all default settings
        Returns:
        a schema factory instance

      • fromSchema

        public JsonSchema fromSchema(JsonNode schema,
                    String path)
        Create a schema instance from a JSON Schema, at a certain path

        For instance, if you submit this schema:

             {
         "schema1": { ... },
         "schema2": { ... }
     }

        then you can create a validator for schema1 using:

             final JsonSchema schema = factory.create(schema, "#/schema1");

        The path can be a JsonPointer as above, but also an id reference.

        Parameters:
        schema - the schema
        path - the pointer/id reference into the schema
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance
        See Also:
        JsonFragment

      • fromSchema

        public JsonSchema fromSchema(JsonNode schema)
        Create a schema instance from a JSON Schema

        This calls fromSchema(JsonNode, String) with "" as a path.

        Parameters:
        schema - the schema
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance

      • fromURI

        public JsonSchema fromURI(URI uri,
                 String path)
                   throws JsonSchemaException
        Create a schema instance from a JSON Schema located at a given URI, and at a given path

        This allows you, for instance, to load a schema using HTTP. Or, in fact, any other URI scheme that is supported.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI
        path - the JSON Pointer/id reference into the downloaded schema
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - unable to get content from that URI
        See Also:
        URIManager, SchemaRegistry

      • fromURI

        public JsonSchema fromURI(URI uri)
                   throws JsonSchemaException
        Create a schema instance from a JSON Schema located at a given URI
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - unable to get content from that URI
        See Also:
        fromSchema(JsonNode, String)

      • fromURI

        public JsonSchema fromURI(String str)
                   throws JsonSchemaException
        Create a schema instance from a JSON Schema located at a given URI
        Parameters:
        str - the URI as a string
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - unable to get content from that URI
        IllegalArgumentException - URI is invalid
        See Also:
        URI.create(String), fromURI(URI, String)

      • getSchema

        @Deprecated
public SchemaContainer getSchema(URI uri)
                          throws JsonSchemaException
        Deprecated. use fromURI(URI) instead; scheduled for removal in 1.3+
        Get a schema container from a given URI

        This is the other way to obtain a container (the other is registerSchema(JsonNode)).

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI
        Returns:
        a schema container
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - cannot get schema from URI, or not a schema
        See Also:
        SchemaRegistry.get(URI)

      • getSchema

        @Deprecated
public SchemaContainer getSchema(String str)
                          throws JsonSchemaException
        Deprecated. use fromURI(String) instead; scheduled for removal in 1.3+
        Get a schema container from a given URI

        This calls getSchema(URI) and uses URI.create(String) to build the URI

        Parameters:
        str - the URI as a string
        Returns:
        a schema container
        Throws:
        JsonSchemaException - cannot get schema from URI, or not a schema
        IllegalArgumentException - string is not a valid URI
        See Also:
        URI.create(String)

      • createSchema

        @Deprecated
public JsonSchema createSchema(SchemaContainer container)
        Deprecated. use one of the .from*() methods instead; scheduled for removal in 1.3+
        Create a schema from a container

        This is one of the constructors you will use. The other is createSchema(SchemaContainer, String).

        Parameters:
        container - the schema container
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance

      • createSchema

        @Deprecated
public JsonSchema createSchema(SchemaContainer container,
                                 String path)
        Deprecated. use fromSchema(JsonNode, String) instead; scheduled for removal in 1.3+
        Create a schema from a container, at a certain path

        For instance, if you register this schema:

             {
         "schema1": { ... },
         "schema2": { ... }
     }

        then you can create a validator for schema1 using:

             final JsonSchema schema = factory.create(container, "#/schema1");

        The path can be a JsonPointer as above, but also an id reference.

        Parameters:
        container - the schema container
        path - the pointer/id reference into the schema
        Returns:
        a JsonSchema instance
